alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Franklin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 5:13PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Colbert and eastern Franklin Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 512 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Russellville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Russellville, Phil Campbell, Littleville, Newburg, Tharptown, Isbell, Spruce Pine, Rockwood and Cedar Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is also occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
